attempts.raw_output:
Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Topology Filter

/--
Prove that $f(n) = 1-n$ is the only integer-valued function defined on the integers that satisfies the following conditions.
\begin{itemize}
\item[(i)] $f(f(n)) = n$, for all integers $n$;
\item[(ii)] $f(f(n+2)+2) = n$ for all integers $n$;
\item[(iii)] $f(0) = 1$.
\end{itemize}
-/
theorem putnam_1992_a1
  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔
  (∀ n : ℤ, f (f n) = n) ∧ (∀ n : ℤ, f (f (n + 2) + 2) = n) ∧ (f 0 = 1) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1992_a1
  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔
  (∀ n : ℤ, f (f n) = n) ∧ (∀ n : ℤ, f (f (n + 2) + 2) = n) ∧ (f 0 = 1) := by
  constructor
  · rintro rfl
    constructor
    · intro n
      simp [sub_eq_add_neg]
      <;> ring
    · constructor
      · intro n
        simp [sub_eq_add_neg]
        <;> ring
      · simp
  · rintro ⟨h1, h2, h3⟩
    funext n
    have h4 := h1 n
    have h5 := h2 n
    have h6 := h2 (n + 2)
    have h7 := h1 (n + 2)
    have h8 := h1 (n + 1)
    have h9 := h2 (n + 1)
    have h10 := h2 (n + 3)
    have h11 := h1 (n + 3)
    have h12 := h1 (n + 4)
    have h13 := h2 (n + 4)
    simp at *
    <;> ring_nf at *
    <;> omega
```

import Mathlib

open Real Nat Topology MeasureTheory
open scoped BigOperators

theorem putnam_1992_a1
  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔
  (∀ n : ℤ, f (f n) = n) ∧ (∀ n : ℤ, f (f (n + 2) + 2) = n) ∧ (f 0 = 1) := by
  constructor
  · rintro rfl
    constructor
    · intro n
      simp [sub_eq_add_neg]
      <;> ring
    · constructor
      · intro n
        simp [sub_eq_add_neg]
        <;> ring
      · simp
  · rintro ⟨h1, h2, h3⟩
    funext n
    have h4 := h1 n
    have h5 := h2 n
    have h6 := h2 (n + 2)
    have h7 := h1 (n + 2)
    have h8 := h1 (n + 1)
    have h9 := h2 (n + 1)
    have h10 := h2 (n + 3)
    have h11 := h1 (n + 3)
    have h12 := h1 (n + 4)
    have h13 := h2 (n + 4)
    simp at *
    <;> ring_nf at *
    <;> omega

```lean4
import Mathlib

open Topology Filter

/--
Prove that $f(n) = 1-n$ is the only integer-valued function defined on the integers that satisfies the following conditions.
\begin{itemize}
\item[(i)] $f(f(n)) = n$, for all integers $n$;
\item[(ii)] $f(f(n+2)+2) = n$ for all integers $n$;
\item[(iii)] $f(0) = 1$.
\end{itemize}
-/
theorem putnam_1992_a1
  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔
  (∀ n : ℤ, f (f n) = n) ∧ (∀ n : ℤ, f (f (n + 2) + 2) = n) ∧ (f 0 = 1) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1992_a1
  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔
  (∀ n : ℤ, f (f n) = n) ∧ (∀ n : ℤ, f (f (n + 2) + 2) = n) ∧ (f 0 = 1) := by
  apply Iff.intro
  · rintro rfl
    constructor
    · intro n
      simp [sub_sub, sub_add, add_comm]
      <;> ring
    constructor
    · intro n
      simp [sub_sub, sub_add, add_comm]
      <;> ring
    · simp
  · rintro ⟨h1, h2, h3⟩
    funext n
    have h4 := h1 n
    have h5 := h1 (n + 2)
    have h6 := h2 n
    have h7 := h2 (n + 2)
    have h8 := h1 0
    have h9 := h1 1
    have h10 := h1 (-1)
    have h11 := h1 2
    have h12 := h1 (-2)
    have h13 := h2 0
    have h14 := h2 1
    have h15 := h2 (-1)
    have h16 := h2 2
    have h17 := h2 (-2)
    simp at *
    <;> omega
```

import Mathlib

open scoped BigOperators

theorem putnam_1992_a1
  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔
  (∀ n : ℤ, f (f n) = n) ∧ (∀ n : ℤ, f (f (n + 2) + 2) = n) ∧ (f 0 = 1) := by
  constructor
  · rintro rfl
    constructor
    · intro n
      simp [sub_eq_add_neg]
      <;> ring
    · constructor
      · intro n
        simp [sub_eq_add_neg]
        <;> ring
      · simp
  · rintro ⟨h₁, h₂, h₃⟩
    funext n
    have h₄ := h₁ n
    have h₅ := h₁ (n + 2)
    have h₆ := h₂ n
    have h₇ := h₂ (n + 2)
    have h₈ := h₁ 0
    have h₉ := h₁ 1
    have h₁₀ := h₁ (-1)
    have h₁₁ := h₂ 0
    have h₁₂ := h₂ 1
    have h₁₃ := h₂ (-1)
    simp at *
    <;> omega

  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔

```lean4
theorem putnam_1992_a1
  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔
  (∀ n : ℤ, f (f n) = n) ∧ (∀ n : ℤ, f (f (n + 2) + 2) = n) ∧ (f 0 = 1) := by
  apply Iff.intro
  · rintro rfl
    constructor
    · intro n
      simp [sub_sub, sub_add, add_sub_cancel]
      <;> ring
    · constructor
      · intro n
        simp [sub_sub, sub_add, add_sub_cancel]
        <;> ring
      · simp
  · rintro ⟨h1, h2, h3⟩
    funext n
    have h4 := h1 n
    have h5 := h1 (n + 2)
    have h6 := h2 n
    have h7 := h2 (n + 2)
    have h8 := h1 0
    have h9 := h1 1
    have h10 := h1 (-1)
    have h11 := h1 2
    have h12 := h1 (-2)
    simp at h4 h5 h6 h7 h8 h9 h10 h11 h12
    have h13 : f n = 1 - n := by
      omega
    exact h13
```

import Mathlib

open Real Nat Topology MeasureTheory
open scoped BigOperators

theorem putnam_1992_a1
  (f : ℤ → ℤ) :
  (f = fun n ↦ 1 - n) ↔
  (∀ n : ℤ, f (f n) = n) ∧ (∀ n : ℤ, f (f (n + 2) + 2) = n) ∧ (f 0 = 1) := by
  apply Iff.intro
  · rintro rfl
    constructor
    · intro n
      simp [sub_sub, sub_add, add_sub_cancel]
      <;> ring
    · constructor
      · intro n
        simp [sub_sub, sub_add, add_sub_cancel]
        <;> ring
      · simp
  · rintro ⟨h1, h2, h3⟩
    funext n
    have h4 := h1 n
    have h5 := h1 (n + 2)
    have h6 := h2 n
    have h7 := h2 (n + 2)
    have h8 := h1 0
    have h9 := h1 1
    have h10 := h1 (-1)
    have h11 := h1 2
    have h12 := h1 (-2)
